Squaresoft > SquareEnix.

snippet.textDisplay: Hard to believe this soundtrack was Jeremy Soule's first major work. He wasn't even quite 20 when the game came out. And he already was displaying the talent of people who had been composing music for various formats for very long periods of time.

snippet.textDisplay: @Cordiiiii That's a cute story Cordiiiii :).  I did something similar with my little sister.  Back in 1994 (I was 13 she was 3) I was playing Final Fantasy VI and I was grinding my characters to high levels, and I let her play for awhile.  I told her how to move the character around the world map and when a battle would happen I told her to press the one button (attack) over and over.  I had no chance of dying and she helped me gain some experience, and she got to play a little bit.
snippet.textOriginal: @Cordiiiii That's a cute story Cordiiiii :).  I did something similar with my little sister.  Back in 1994 (I was 13 she was 3) I was playing Final Fantasy VI and I was grinding my characters to high levels, and I let her play for awhile.  I told her how to move the character around the world map and when a battle would happen I told her to press the one button (attack) over and over.  I had no chance of dying and she helped me gain some experience, and she got to play a little bit.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm SO happy that you actually included a song from SoE in this playlist :))
I remember when I was about 4 years old I always wanted to play that game along with my older brother... I kept complaining and complaining and finally my brother gave me the 2nd gamepad and told me I could play the dog... Now we all know there is no 2 player mode in that game but I didn't know and I didn't really notice... So I was happy and kept my mouth shut "playing" the dog... :DD And my brother had some peace :D
snippet.textOriginal:
I'm SO happy that you actually included a song from SoE in this playlist :))

Now we all know there is no 2 player mode in that game but I didn't know and I didn't really notice... So I was happy and kept my mouth shut "playing" the dog... :DD And my brother had some peace :D

snippet.textDisplay: This is no doubt my favorite SNES game of all time. My favorite section of this game was the Dark Forest Maze, I had SUCCCCCH good times there, this game was SOOOOO epic, I wish Square Enix did a remake of it, but very unlikely, at least the same game mechanics would be nice!

snippet.textDisplay: This is a vastly underrated game. It has a very moody tone and soundtrack that set it apart from most other games of its time. I'd say I enjoy it every bit as much as Secret of Mana.

snippet.textDisplay:
happens sometimes dude
i saw a movie when I was a little kid and thought I would never see the movie again because it was a chinese dubbed japanese movie.  Then one day, 14 years after I saw the movie, I begin to think back about it, and surprisingly I found in stores.  It was "Castle In the Sky".

happens sometimes dude

snippet.textDisplay: Well, this actually isn't the boss music--this is the mini-boss music.  If you want to hear the actual boss music, do a search for it on YouTube (or do a search for one of the many bosses in the game...say, for example, Verminator, or Salabog).
snippet.textOriginal: Well, this actually isn't the boss music--this is the mini-boss music.  If you want to hear the actual boss music, do a search for it on YouTube (or do a search for one of the many bosses in the game...say, for example, Verminator, or Salabog).
